donor_name: UNITED STATES AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT (USAID)
outputs.output_descr:
The Rural Youth Poverty Reduction Project will contribute to the reduction of rural youth unemployment by increasing the ability of youths to access sustainable livelihood options. This will be achieved through the capacitating of rural youth through the provision of skills training and increased access to post harvest production facilities to improve the agriculture value added. The aim is to increase the number of youths in the targeted communities who are actively employed or earning a living directly or indirectly through agriculture. In addition youths will have the necessary skills to identify and access opportunities for engaging in other businesses along the agriculture value chain. Expected outputs include:

1.	Baseline study to identify target population and target markets, training requirements, output targets and monitoring indicators
2.	Training and capacity building for rural youth in various technical and management practices related to agriculture and agro-processing
3.	Business Development
4.	Progress monitoring and output evaluations

This project seeks to help to develop sustainable economic opportunities for the target group, within the context of broader development work under the current Jamaica Violence Prevention, Peace and Sustainable Development (JVPPSD) project.
1) Baseline study and capacity development
a - Economic survey and mapping of community assets in select communities.
b -Identification of potential areas and markets for business development.
c - Identification of training needs.
d - Establishment of economic mapping unit at Social Development Commission

2) Engagement of unemployed target population
a - Community mobilization activities to raise awareness of the project and engage unemployed male youth.
3) Training for target population
a - Entrepreneurial training.
b - Life skills, business readiness and conflict resolution.
c - Business development and fore sighting
4)  Product and business development
a - Development of community workshop facility.
b - Incubator support for selected prospective businesses
